intro: Oxydectes gracilis, commonly known as the slender oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow in the center and white petals surrounding them, blooming from late spring to early summer. Oxydectes gracilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
